intro: Descurainia glabrescens, commonly known as hoary whitlowgrass, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its leaves are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. The flowers are yellow and produce small, rounded pods that contain several seeds.
